skuid__text.contents: All content should be nested within sections. Sections act as visual separation of information and help navigate users through the screen.
Sidebar List should use Compact List variant. Also, lists should only have maximum of 2 columns. Use a Table instead if you want to show more than 2 columns

Modals should have a consistent width of 560px.

Use modals for 
  • Confirmation of deletion
  • View/Edit all fields of a record
  • Quick actions like Assign Task, Mark Case as Close

skuid__file.buttonLabel: Browse or Drag files here to upload

Fatback spare ribs doner kevin flank alcatra kielbasa ball tip pastrami venison shank. Sirloin frankfurter shankle pig alcatra chuck andouille kielbasa turducken kevin pork belly beef ribs.
Form in Section in Read Mode (with Edit Mode option in Modal)

A few guidelines to keep modals consistent
  • Set all modals to 560px width
  • When using Forms in Modal, only use one field per row
  • Modals should be reserved for quick actions
  • Always have buttons on the right side
  • Primary button (Done, Save & Closed, etc) should be the first one on the right 
  • Use After Close Actions to cancel model changes (since users can click outside of modal to close it, it's best to always cancel any unsaved changes after closing modals to prevent accidental data changes)
Bacon ipsum dolor amet flank burgdoggen fatback t-bone shoulder pig ball tip chicken tri-tip filet mignon jerky salami biltong beef ribs. Cow cupim frankfurter spare ribs tenderloin.
Confirmation Modal for delete action. Make sure user knows which record is being deleted.

New Record modal is like Quick create, so only include Required and most important fields, then allow users to go to the Detail page to add more info or Save & Close modal to continue on current page.
Tooltip styling: Compact, Dark, and to the Right

skuid__button.label: Hover over me to see tooltip

skuid__text.contents: Hold on there! Are you sure?
You're about to delete opportunity: {{Name}}. Are you sure you want to delete it?
